Preparing Data¶

Required files¶

In order to run fivepseq, the following files are required:

Genomic sequence file (.fasta)
Genomic annotation file (.gff/ .gtf)
Aligned reads (.bam)
Alignment index (.bai)

Sourcing genome and annotation files¶

There are multiple resources which maintain and distribute sequence and annotation data, for instance Ensembl, RefSeq, and SGD. However, the naming conventions and format may differ slightly depending on resource. For this reason, we recommend that your genomic and annotation files are to be retrieved from the same database.


Pre-processing of sequencing data¶

An example of pre-processing pipeline can be found here. In order to run this pipeline, you need to have access to common bioinformatics software such as STAR, umi_tools, BEDtools, samtools, FastQC, MultiQC and cutadapt.

fivepseq
